summary: Email correspondence between a Senior Financial Investigator (SFI) and the USAO-SDNY regarding a subpoena rider for L.S.J., LLC, a Delaware corporation owned by Jeffrey Epstein that previously owned Little St. James Island. The document discusses serving a subpoena on the Delaware Secretary of State to obtain information about this Epstein entity.

persons.name: Stephen B. Hessinger
persons.context: Appears as the sender/author of emails discussing the subpoena rider for L.S.J., LLC, an Epstein entity. He is part of Squad C-40 FAST.

persons.name: Allison
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who may not have forwarded the subpoena rider to the recipient.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the owner of L.S.J., LLC and Nautilus Inc., entities involved in property ownership of Little St. James Island.

connections.description: Hessinger is investigating Epstein's financial entities, specifically L.S.J., LLC, as part of a financial investigation.

events.title: Conveyance of Little St. James Island
events.description: L.S.J., LLC (an Epstein entity) conveyed Little St. James Island to Nautilus Inc., another Epstein entity.

events.title: Subpoena Preparation for L.S.J., LLC
events.description: Email correspondence regarding the preparation and service of a subpoena rider on the Delaware Secretary of State for information about L.S.J., LLC.

locations: 6100 Red Hook Quarter, Suite B-3, St Thomas, USVI 00802
keyFacts: L.S.J., LLC is a Delaware corporation owned by Jeffrey Epstein that previously owned Little St. James Island.
L.S.J., LLC conveyed Little St. James Island to Nautilus Inc. in 2011, which is also an Epstein entity.
The address used for L.S.J., LLC is 6100 Red Hook Quarter, Suite B-3, St Thomas, USVI 00802, despite being a Delaware corporation.
A subpoena rider was being prepared in August 2019 to serve on the Delaware Secretary of State to obtain information about L.S.J., LLC as part of an investigation.
The correspondence involves a Senior Financial Investigator (SFI) from Squad C-40 FAST and the USAO-SDNY, indicating active financial investigation into Epstein's entities.
